metadata.Title: CVE-2009-3575 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Buffer overflow in DHTRoutingTableDeserializer.cc in aria2 0.15.3, 1.2.0, and other versions allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code via unknown vectors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2009-3575` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

aria2 - 1.18.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: aria2 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.18.1-1').
